snippet: It’s in Texas, of course, where football is revered. And it’s not the only massive facility, leading some to argue that local schools are engaged in an arms race.
abstract: Voters in McKinney, Tex, approve almost $63 million for 12,000-seat high school football stadium and events center, which opponents claim is needlessly large and part of escalating competition with nearby towns that have built similar facilities.
lead_paragraph: It’s in Texas, of course, where football is revered. And it’s not the only massive facility, leading some to argue that local schools are engaged in an arms race.

headline.main: That’s Right, $63 Million for a Football Stadium … for High Schoolers
headline.print_headline: Football Stadium in Texas Comes With 12,000 Seats and a $63 Million Price Tag
